faqs.question: Do I need to know a specific programming language or framework?
faqs.answer: No. This accelerator is language and framework-agnostic. Whether you're a React developer, Python backend engineer, Java developer, mobile developer, or anything else ‚Äî the skills we teach (engineering thinking, clean code, Git, interviewing, branding) apply universally to any tech role.

faqs.question: Do I need prior coding experience?
faqs.answer:
Yes, but nothing fancy. If you have the following basics, you're ready:

‚Ä¢ Variables and data types
‚Ä¢ Control flow
‚Ä¢ Loops
‚Ä¢ Functions and parameters
‚Ä¢ Basic understanding of one programming language

We focus on bridging the gap from 'I can code' to 'I'm industry-ready,' not teaching programming from scratch.

What does 'basic knowledge' mean? You should be able to write simple programs and understand basic error messages. Think: solved some coding challenges, completed a beginner tutorial, or built a small personal project.

faqs.question: Will I get a job after the accelerator?
faqs.answer: We can't guarantee job placement, but we equip you with the exact skills, portfolio, and interview preparation that dramatically increase your chances. Many of our students found jobs within the next month. Your success depends on your effort and commitment.

faqs.question: What's the time commitment?
faqs.answer: Expect ~2-3 hours per week of live sessions. The other ~5 hours are from your personal effort (project work and independent learning).

faqs.question: How many people will be in my cohort?
faqs.answer: Maximum 15 people per cohort. This small size ensures we can provide targeted, personalized care and address your specific needs throughout the program.

faqs.question: Is this accelerator remote?
faqs.answer: Yes, 100% remote. All sessions are conducted online, making it accessible from anywhere in Greece.

faqs.question: What if I miss a live session?
faqs.answer: All sessions are recorded. While we strongly encourage live attendance for Q&A, mentorship, and networking, you can catch up asynchronously if needed.

faqs.question: Is this only for people looking for jobs in Greece?
faqs.answer: No. While we're based in Greece and many of our students seek Greek opportunities, the skills and approach work globally. The accelerator prepares you for tech roles anywhere.

faqs.question: What happens after I book a call?
faqs.answer: We'll discuss your goals, answer any questions, and if it's a good fit, we'll finalize your enrollment and secure your early bird pricing.

faqs.question: What are the payment options?
faqs.answer:
Pay the full amount now, or 50% upfront and 50% at the start of the program, if that works for you.

If neither option works for you, send us a message and we'll try to find a solution together.

journey.timelineDescription: How we went from dozens of job rejections to building DevReady

timeline.title: The Beginning: Rejections, Rejections, Rejections
timeline.description: After graduating, Alex and Kostas tried to land jobs abroad. Reality hit hard: rejection after rejection. They quickly realized how much they didn't know. No one had taught them how the industry actually works, how to interview, or how to present themselves. So they helped each other, started their careers in Greece, learned the hard way, and eventually managed to land roles abroad.

timeline.title: Gaining Experience and Expertise
timeline.description: Alex and Kostas worked at different companies across London, Greece, Barcelona, and Belgium. They failed and learned, iterated and improved. Through trial and error, they became professionals in the industry, understanding not just how to code, but how the tech world really operates. They learned what companies actually look for and how to navigate interviews.

timeline.title: Vasilis's Break into Tech
timeline.description: Vasilis was a close friend of Alex and Kostas. After graduating, he struggled to find his first job in tech. He reached out for help, and they guided him through the process: engineering, interview prep, portfolio building, CV optimization. With their mentorship, Vasilis landed his first engineering role.

timeline.title: We Did It Again and Again and Again
timeline.description: Organically, we started helping more friends break into tech. Then we began mentoring others 1-on-1, people we didn't even know. Alex had already started mentoring engineers at Codurance and Skyscanner. The pattern was clear: structured guidance works, and more people needed it.

timeline.title: The DevReady Idea is Born
timeline.description: We were sitting at a coffee shop in Athens when the idea hit us, almost casually. What if we could turn everything we learned into something structured? What if we could help more people, not just one by one, but at scale? That's when DevReady started to take shape.

timeline.title: Research, Validation & Our First Success Story
timeline.description: We interviewed 100+ aspiring developers across Greece to understand their pain points. The message was clear: Greece has the talent, but lacks structured paths, mentorship, and industry context. We built DevReady, ran our first cohort, and watched our first students land their dream jobs. The model works.

timeline.title: Next Step: You
timeline.description: Our first cohort launches in April 2026. We're ready to help the next generation of Greek developers break into tech with the exact blueprint we've refined over years. Will you be part of this journey?
